label: 御息所
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Miyasudokoro (Lady of the Bedchamber), a familiar term in Heian texts, was not a formal title, but a name loosely used of any Imperial consort or concubine below the rank of Empress. It referred most often to concubines who bore no official designation (p820).
